summary: This is an FBI 302 interview report of Dr. [REDACTED], a forensic psychologist at the Manhattan Correctional Center (MCC), conducted on September 6, 2019. The interview details her psychological evaluation of inmate Jeffrey Epstein on July 24, 2019, her decision to move him from suicide watch to psychological observation, and her reactions following his death.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The inmate at MCC, registration number 76318-054, who was evaluated by Dr. [REDACTED] on July 24, 2019, while on suicide watch. He was later found dead in his cell.

persons.name: Dr. [REDACTED]
persons.context: A Lieutenant (O3) in the U.S. Public Health Service assigned to MCC. She conducted a psychological evaluation of Jeffrey Epstein on July 24, 2019, and made the decision to move him from suicide watch to psychological observation.

persons.name: Dr. [REDACTED]
persons.context: Concurred with Dr. [REDACTED]'s determination to move Jeffrey Epstein from suicide watch to psychological observation.

connections.description: Dr. [REDACTED] was the duty psychologist who evaluated inmate Jeffrey Epstein on July 24, 2019, and made clinical decisions regarding his suicide watch status.
Dr. [REDACTED] discussed her decision regarding Epstein's suicide watch status with Dr. [REDACTED], who concurred with her determination.

events.title: Psychological Evaluation of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Dr. [REDACTED] evaluated inmate Jeffrey Epstein for approximately 30 minutes while he was on suicide watch. She found him energetic, smiling, appropriate, appreciative, and he adamantly denied suicidal ideation.

events.title: Epstein Moved to Psychological Observation
events.description: Based on her evaluation, Dr. [REDACTED] moved Jeffrey Epstein from suicide watch to a 'step down' of psychological observation, allowing him hygiene products, novels, legal visits, and showers.

events.title: FBI Interview of MCC Psychologist
events.description: FBI agents and Assistant U.S. Attorneys interviewed Dr. [REDACTED] regarding her evaluation of Jeffrey Epstein and the circumstances leading to his death.

locations: Saint Andrews Plaza, NY NY (FBI Office location)
Manhattan Correctional Center (MCC), 150 Park Row, NY NY
keyFacts: Dr. [REDACTED], a forensic psychologist at MCC, evaluated Jeffrey Epstein on July 24, 2019, and found him to be energetic, smiling, respectful, and adamantly denying any interest in suicide.
Epstein reported to the psychologist that his cell mate had injured him, putting a 'car' on his neck, and that he had reported this to a corrections officer.

The psychologist decided to move Epstein from suicide watch to psychological observation, a step-down status that allowed him more privileges, with the concurrence of Dr. [REDACTED] and an Associate Warden.
Epstein was housed in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) for his own safety but was not in protective custody.
The psychologist expressed being upset about Epstein's death, describing it as a 'tragic' incident where 'you never want to lose a life'.
